message.content:
cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SY, cs.CR

This paper focuses on predicting a driver's intent to brake in car-following scenarios using onboard data from CAN-Bus, radar, and cameras. The learning-based inference method involves using a Gaussian mixture model (GMM) and a hidden Markov model (HMM) to infer drivers' braking decisions. This approach involves both human-computer interaction (HCI) and machine learning (ML) techniques, which suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.HC sub-category. Additionally, the use of GMM and HMM models suggests that the paper could also belong to the cs.LG and cs.SY sub-categories, which focus on machine learning and control systems, respectively. The use of camera data suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.CV sub-category, which focuses on computer vision. Finally, the focus on safety systems suggests that the paper could also belong to the cs.CR sub-category, which focuses on cryptography and security.
